conclusion: Analyze the relationship between force F and acceleration a using Newton's second law and friction.
The graph shows a linear relationship between F and a.
The equation of the line is a = (1/m)F - μg.
The slope of the line is 1/m.
From the graph, the slope is 8/60 = 2/15.
The y-intercept of the line is -μg.
From the graph, the y-intercept is 2 m/s².
Given g = 10 m/s², solve -μ × 10 = 2 to get μ = 0.2.
The coefficient of kinetic friction between A and B is 0.2.
The mass of A is 7.5 kg.
